newsitem.title: SWEDEN: SCA says tax could push Swedish companies abroad.
newsitem.headline: SCA says tax could push Swedish companies abroad.

text.p: Swedish forestry group SCA said on Thursday that it and other export companies could move operations abroad if the domestic tax pressure in Sweden was not eased.
"If it doesn't become better in Sweden long-term, operations could slip abroad at a faster and faster rate," SCA chief executive Sverker Martin-Lof told Reuters.
SCA keeps analysing the advantages and disadvantages of moving operations abroad, including its headquarters, he said.
"Our experience from Packaging is very positive," Martin-Lof said, referring to the packaging operation which has more than 90 manufacturing plants in a dozen countries.
Martin-Lof said the key problem was getting competent people to move to Sweden.
"We have tried many times but it always fails because of the economic part," he said, pointing out that foreigners feared taking too much of a salary cut by coming to Sweden.
Martin-Lof was not impressed by recent proposals to ease tax for key foreign staff temporarily working in Sweden.
